intro: Circaea hsuehshanensis, commonly known as the Hsuehshan beautyberry, is a species of flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers. The plant produces small, dark blue berries that are edible but not particularly flavorful. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in some horticultural settings.
